text: I actively contribute ideas and suggestions during team meetings instead of staying silent.
I support my teammates' decisions and help them succeed instead of competing against them.
I take initiative to lead when the team needs direction instead of waiting for others to step up.
I listen actively to understand different perspectives before making team decisions instead of pushing my own agenda.
I help resolve conflicts between team members instead of avoiding difficult conversations.
I share credit for team successes with all members instead of taking individual recognition.
I adapt my working style to complement my teammates' strengths instead of insisting on my own methods.
I provide constructive feedback to help teammates improve instead of criticizing or avoiding feedback.
I take on tasks that others find challenging to support the team instead of only doing what I prefer.
I communicate clearly and keep teammates informed about my progress instead of working in isolation.
I help organize and coordinate team activities instead of leaving planning to others.
I celebrate my teammates' achievements and milestones instead of focusing only on my own goals.
I step back and let others lead when they have better expertise instead of always taking control.
I help teammates who are struggling with their tasks instead of focusing solely on my own work.
I build consensus and find common ground when team members disagree instead of taking sides.
I take responsibility for team failures and learn from mistakes instead of blaming others.
I share knowledge and resources with teammates instead of keeping information to myself.
I help create a positive and inclusive team environment instead of allowing negativity to spread.
I balance my individual goals with team objectives instead of prioritizing only my own interests.
I contribute strategic thinking and long-term planning to help the team succeed instead of focusing only on immediate tasks.
